result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chelsea M Mariani

records.addlTxt:
2:17 PM Defendant Chelsea M Mariani appeared by video from RC Jail.  Attorney Annette M Barna in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Krave does not appear for today's hearing. Heard along with 2021CF204, 2022CF29, 2022CF46, 2022CF67, 2022CF70.  Court cannot proceed today without Atty Krave, will attempt to get this back on the calendar possibly Friday. Adj 2:19pm. 

2:32 pm Back on the record.  DE appears in person with Atty James Krave.  DA Annette Barna appears for the State of WI.  DE will enter a plea in:

2021CF204-

2022CF29-Ct 4

2022CF46-Ct 2

All other counts and cases will be DRI.

Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  DE advised of Constitutional Rights, Factual basis/ PC found, plea freely, knowingly, voluntarily, intelligently made, court accepts plea of G, finds DE guilty. 

21CF204, 22CF29- Recommended sentence will be for withheld sentence, 3 years probation. DE will complete an AODA assessment and any follow up recommended, DE will complete an Anger Management program, maintain absolute sobriety, pay CC, provide DNA/pay surcharge, comply with all DOC recommendations for programming.
21CF204-1 day credit
2022CF29-53 days credit
2022CF46-5 days credit
2022CF67-6 days credit
2022CF70-23 days credit.

State enters sentencing argument. Victim rights have been complied with. Sentencing argument entered by Atty Krave.  DE makes a statement to the court. Court will accept the recommended sentence, make this an order of the court.

2:17 PM Defendant Chelsea M Mariani appeared by video from RC Jail.  Attorney Annette M Barna in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Krave does not appear for today's hearing. Heard along with 2021CF204, 2022CF29, 2022CF46, 2022CF67, 2022CF70.  Court cannot proceed today without Atty Krave, will attempt to get this back on the calendar possibly Friday. Adj 2:19pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

02:36 PM Defendant Chelsea M Mariani in court with attorney James H Krave.  Defendant Chelsea M Mariani in custody.  Annette M Barna appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Chelsea M Mariani appeared by video means with Attorney.  

22CF46, 22CF70-Waive formal reading of the CC.  DE will waive PH in 22CF46, 22CF70. Court instructs on waiver of PH, DE understands waiver, Waiver knowingly, freely, voluntarily, intelligently entered, court will accept waiver of PH.  Court reviews PC, finds PC, will bind over for Trial.  

Set cases for Plea/Sentencing May 2, 2022 @ 2:00PM. Adj 2:47pm
Plea hearing on April 13, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on April 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

No contact with G.G., DN. or their residences,   Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores or any other establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.    No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  No possession of medications not prescribed to you by a physician.  Defendant is not to possess or consume any medications not prescribed by a physician.  Not to possess or consume any illicit substances.  All prescribed medications must remain in the original container and be taken only as prescribed.

1:22 PM  Attorney DA Annette Barna appeared via video.  Attorney Kathryn Cook appeared.   The DE appeared from the Rusk County Jail.  Matter set for bond hearing.  State argued for a $2000 cash bond with conditions she not leave Rusk County during pendency of cases, daily PBT at DE expense, no contact with G.G. or his residence or D.N. or her residence and absolute sobriety conditions.   Court reviewed allegations.     Attorney Taber argued for a signature bond.     Court ordered $2000 cash bond with conditions no contact with G.G., DN. or their residences,   Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores or any other establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.    No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  No possession of medications not prescribed to you by a physician.  Defendant is not to possess or consume any medications not prescribed by a physician.  Not to possess or consume any illicit substances.  All prescribed medications must remain in the original container and be taken only as prescribed.  INIT set for 3/29/22 at 1:00 PM. Adj. 1:31 PM
Hold for bond hearing, victim notification and input
